title: Cleaning The Stable | Feeding Cows With Hay

tasks.task: Planting a tree in the ground.
subtasks: Locate a suitable spot for the tree.
Dig a hole deep enough for the roots.
Remove the tree from its container or packaging.
Place the tree into the hole, ensuring it's upright.
Fill the hole with soil, tamping it down as needed.
Water the newly planted tree.
Unpack the wind turbine components.
Assemble the turbine structure on-site.
Connect the turbine to the electrical grid or battery storage.
Secure the turbine to a stable foundation or structure.
Check all connections and safety features before operation.

tasks.task: Checking water levels in crop fields.
subtasks: Drive or walk through fields to check water levels.
Use tools like a water meter or visually assess the soil moisture.
Take samples if necessary for precise measurement.
Document findings and adjust watering schedules as needed.

tasks.task: Plowing a field with a tractor.
subtasks: Load the tractor with the appropriate form of plowing equipment.
Operate the tractor around the field, adjusting direction as needed.
Monitor the depth and coverage of the soil being plowed.
Check for obstructions or equipment malfunctions.
Refuel or attend to the tractor as needed during the operation.
Identify the area where the fence is damaged.
Remove any broken components or wires.
Gather replacement materials and tools.
Reconstruct the fence, ensuring it is secure and aligned.
Connect all parts securely and test the fence for stability.

tasks.task: Collecting harvested apples from a trailer.
subtasks: Drive the trailer to the storage or processing area.
Unload the apples carefully to avoid damage.
Inspect the apples for quality and damage.
Sort and categorize the apples as needed for market or storage.
Disassemble the milking machine for cleaning.
Apply cleaning agents and solutions as per guidelines.
Reassemble the machine and check each component.
Test the machine's operation to ensure proper milk flow.
Adjust settings as necessary to improve efficiency and comfort for the cow.
Position the combine at the beginning of a row.
Set the combine's speed and headers according to the crop.
Operate the combine, cutting and threshing the crop.
Manage the debris and grain falling from the combine.
Guide the combine through the field, avoiding obstructions.

tasks.task: Checking the seal on a silo.
subtasks: Inspect the silo's structure for cracks or gaps.
Test the seal around feed openings or doors.
Address any leaks or poor seals with appropriate repairs.
Monitor the silo's conditions regularly to prevent issues.
Set up the mower-conditioner in the field.
Operate the machine to cut and condition the hay.
Fold the hay into windrows for drying.
Collect the hay once dry and bale it.
Survey the area around the power line to ensure safety.
Notify the utility company or appropriate authority.
Wait for professionals to arrive and handle the situation.
If necessary, provide assistance or information to the responders.
Operate the planter to open the ground and plant seeds.
Adjust the planter's depth and spacing as necessary.
Monitor rows planted to ensure consistent coverage.
Refill seed and fertilizer hoppers as needed.
Start the mower and adjust to field conditions.
Drive the mower through the field, cutting the grass or crops.
Regulate speed to minimize missed areas or repeated cuts.
Check for any part malfunctions or fuel levels.
Calibrate the equipment to correctly distribute the fertilizer.
Operate the equipment across the field, covering it evenly.
Check for even distribution and correct equipment settings.
Note any areas that may need additional treatment.
Position the irrigation system to cover the field uniformly.
Check for any blocked nozzles or uneven water flow.
Ensure the system is operating at the correct pressure and duration.
Monitor water usage and adjust as necessary.
Assemble the fuel injector pump and connect it to the fuel system.
Test the pump's operation to check fuel flow and pressure.
Adjust settings or components if under or over-fueling occurs.
Regularly service the pump to prevent issues.
Position the snowplow attachment on the front of a tractor.
Secure all connections for safety.
Clear snow from driveways, roads, or fields as needed.
Check the plow's depth and adjust_LOADED_SUBTASKS
